017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
020import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
021import java.lang.invoke.VarHandle;
022
023import java.util.ArrayDeque;
024import java.util.ArrayList;
025import java.util.Collection;
026import java.util.Collections;
027import java.util.HashSet;
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Objects;
031import java.util.Queue;
032
033import java.util.function.Function;
034import java.util.function.Predicate;
035
036import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
037import org.microbean.development.annotation.EntryPoint;
038import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;
039import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
040import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
041
042/**
043 * A value-like object representing a (Java-like) type for purposes of
044 * testing assignability.
045 *
046 * <p>Concisely: {@link Type}s represent {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
047 * java.lang.reflect.Type}s (or other frameworks' similar
048 * representations) without any dependence on {@link
049 * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type} itself.</p>
050 *
051 * <p>This class is used directly primarily by the {@link Semantics}
052 * class and its subclasses.</p>
053 *
054 * @param <T> the type of the thing representing a Java type that is
055 * being adapted; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
056 * java.lang.reflect.Type} or some other framework's representation of
057 * one
058 *
059 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
060 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
061 *
062 * @see Semantics
063 */
064@Experimental
065public abstract class Type<T> implements Owner<T> {
066
067
068  /*
069   * Static fields.
070   */
071
072
073  private static final VarHandle SUPERTYPES;
074
075  static {
076    final Lookup lookup = MethodHandles.lookup();
077    try {
078      SUPERTYPES = lookup.findVarHandle(Type.class, "supertypes", List.class);
079    } catch (final NoSuchFieldException | IllegalAccessException reflectiveOperationException) {
080      throw (Error)new ExceptionInInitializerError(reflectiveOperationException.getMessage()).initCause(reflectiveOperationException);
081    }
082  }
083
084
085  /*
086   * Instance fields.
087   */
088
089
090  private final T type;
091
092  private volatile List<? extends Type<T>> supertypes;
093
094
095  /*
096   * Constructors.
097   */
098
099
100  /**
101   * Creates a new {@link Type}.
102   *
103   * @param type the type to represent; must not be {@code null}
104   *
105   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
106   */
107  protected Type(final T type) {
108    super();
109    this.type = Objects.requireNonNull(type, "type");
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Creates a new {@link Type} that models custom supertypes.
114   *
115   * <p>Among other things, this means that the {@link #object()}
116   * method will return {@code null}.</p>
117   *
118   * @param supertypes the custom supertypes; must not be {@code null}
119   *
120   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supertypes} is {@code
121   * null}
122   */
123  protected Type(final List<? extends Type<T>> supertypes) {
124    super();
125    this.type = null;
126    this.supertypes = List.copyOf(supertypes);
127  }
128
129
130  /*
131   * Instance methods.
132   */
133
134
135  /**
136   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
137   * a Java type that has a name.
138   *
139   * <p>In the Java reflective type system, only {@link Class} and
140   * {@link java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable} instances have names.</p>
141   *
142   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
143   * a Java type that has a name
144   *
145   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
146   * and deterministic.
147   *
148   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
149   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
150   *
151   * @see #name()
152   *
153   * @see Class#getName()
154   *
155   * @see java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable#getName()
156   */
157  @Override // Owner<T>
158  @OverridingEncouraged
159  public boolean named() {
160    return Owner.super.named();
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Returns the name of this {@link Type} if it has one <strong>or
165   * {@code null} if it does not</strong>.
166   *
167   * <p>Only classes (and interfaces) and type variables in the Java
168   * reflective type system have names.</p>
169   *
170   * @return the name of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
171   *
172   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
173   * return {@code null}.
174   *
175   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
176   * and deterministic.
177   *
178   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
179   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
180   */
181  @Override // Owner<T>
182  public abstract String name();
183
184  /**
185   * Returns the object supplied at construction time that is the type
186   * this {@link Type} is representing, or {@code null} if this
187   * information is not available, or if this {@link Type} {@linkplain
188   * #customSupertyped() represents a collection of custom
189   * supertypes}.
190   *
191   * @return the object supplied at construction time that is the type
192   * this {@link Type} is representing
193   *
194   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
195   *
196   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
197   *
198   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
199   * threads.
200   */
201  @Override // Owner<T>
202  public final T object() {
203    return this.type;
204  }
205
206  /**
207   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
208   * the uppermost reference type in the type system.
209   *
210   * <p>In all practical cases, if an implementation of this method
211   * returns {@code true}, it means this {@link Type} represents
212   * {@link Object Object.class}.</p>
213   *
214   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
215   * meet these requirements.</p>
216   *
217   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
218   * the uppermost reference type in the type system, e.g. {@link
219   * Object Object.class}
220   *
221   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
222   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
223   *
224   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
225   * and deterministic.
226   */
227  public abstract boolean top();
228
229  /**
230   * Returns a (possibly cached) {@link List} of this {@link Type}'s
231   * <em>direct supertypes</em>, defined to be its immediate
232   * superclass or supertype, if any, and any interfaces it directly
233   * implements.
234   *
235   * @return a (possibly cached) {@link List} of this {@link Type}'s
236   * direct supertypes
237   *
238   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
239   *
240   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
241   *
242   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
243   * threads.
244   *
245   * @see #computeDirectSupertypes()
246   */
247  public final List<? extends Type<T>> directSupertypes() {
248    return List.copyOf(this.computeDirectSupertypes());
249  }
250
251  /**
252   * Returns an {@linkplain
253   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable and
254   * immutable <code>List</code>} of the <em>direct
255   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}, or an {@linkplain
256   * List#isEmpty() empty <code>List</code>} if there are
257   * no direct supertypes, or if this {@link Type} implementation does
258   * not distinguish between direct and non-direct supertypes.
259   *
260   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type are defined to be those
261   * analogous to those described by the <a
262   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10.2"
263   * target="_parent">Java Language Specification, section 4.10.2</a>,
264   * minus any types featuring wildcards.</p>
265   *
266   * <p>The {@link List} returned must not contain {@code this}
267   * and must have no {@code null} or duplicate elements.</p>
268   *
269   * <p>The ordering within the returned {@link List} is not
270   * specified, <strong>but must be deterministic between
271   * invocations</strong>.</p>
272   *
273   * <p>The size of the {@link List} returned must not change
274   * between calls.</p>
275   *
276   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
277   * meet these requirements.</p>
278   *
279   * <p><strong>The default implementation of this method returns an
280   * empty {@link List}.</strong> Many subclasses may wish to
281   * override this behavior.</p>
282   *
283   * @return an {@linkplain
284   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable and
285   * immutable <code>List</code>} of the <em>direct
286   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}; never {@code null}
287   *
288   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
289   * return {@code null}.
290   *
291   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
292   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
293   *
294   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
295   * idempotent and deterministic.
296   *
297   * @see JavaTypes#directSupertypes(java.lang.reflect.Type)
298   *
299   * @see #directSupertypes()
300   *
301   * @see #supertypes()
302   *
303   * @see #computeSupertypes()
304   */
305  protected List<? extends Type<T>> computeDirectSupertypes() {
306    return List.of();
307  }
308
309  /**
310   * If this {@link Type} represents a parameterized type or a generic
311   * array type, returns a {@link Type} representing its raw type or
312   * generic component type, or, if this {@link Type} does not
313   * represent a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns
314   * {@code this}.
315   *
316   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
317   * meet these requirements.</p>
318   *
319   * @return a suitable {@link Type}; never {@code null}; often {@code
320   * this}
321   *
322   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return {@code
323   * null}.
324   *
325   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
326   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
327   *
328   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
329   * deterministic.
330   */
331  @Override // Owner<T>
332  public abstract Type<T> type();
333
334  /**
335   * Returns the owner of this {@link Type} as an {@link Owner
336   * Owner&lt;T&gt;}, suitable only for equality comparisons, or
337   * {@code null} if this {@link Type} is not owned.
338   *
339   * @return the owner of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
340   *
341   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
342   * {@code null}.
343   *
344   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
345   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
346   *
347   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
348   * and deterministic.
349   */
350  @Override // Owner<T>
351  public abstract Owner<T> owner();
352
353  /**
354   * Returns a {@link Type}, <strong>usually new</strong>, whose
355   * {@link #object() object()} method will return the supplied {@code
356   * object}.
357   *
358   * @param object the modeled type; must not be {@code null}
359   *
360   * @return a {@link Type}
361   *
362   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code object} is {@code null}
363   *
364   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return {@code
365   * null}.
366   *
367   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be deterministic but
368   * not idempotent.
369   *
370   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
371   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
372   */
373  public abstract Type<T> withObject(final T object);
374
375  /**
376   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
377   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters.
378   *
379   * <p>This implementation calls {@link Owner#hasTypeParameters()}
380   * and returns the result. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a
381   * faster implementation.</p>
382   *
383   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
384   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters
385   *
386   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
387   * idempotent and deterministic.
388   *
389   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
390   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
391   *
392   * @see Owner#hasTypeParameters()
393   *
394   * @see #typeParameters()
395   */
396  @Override // Owner<T>
397  @OverridingEncouraged
398  public boolean hasTypeParameters() {
399    return Owner.super.hasTypeParameters();
400  }
401
402  /**
403   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
404   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments.
405   *
406   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #typeArguments()} method
407   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
408   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
409   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
410   *
411   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
412   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments
413   *
414   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
415   * idempotent and deterministic.
416   *
417   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
418   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
419   *
420   * @see #typeArguments()
421   */
422  @OverridingEncouraged
423  public boolean hasTypeArguments() {
424    final Collection<?> tas = this.typeArguments();
425    return tas != null && !tas.isEmpty();
426  }
427
428  /**
429   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
430   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
431   * parameters.
432   *
433   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
434   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a generic
435   * class.</p>
436   *
437   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
438   * meet these requirements.</p>
439   *
440   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
441   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
442   * parameters; never {@code null}
443   *
444   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
445   * {@code null}.
446   *
447   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
448   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
449   *
450   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
451   * and deterministic.
452   */
453  @Override // Owner<T>
454  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeParameters();
455
456  /**
457   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
458   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
459   * arguments.
460   *
461   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
462   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
463   * parameterized type.</p>
464   *
465   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
466   * meet these requirements.</p>
467   *
468   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
469   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
470   * parameters; never {@code null}
471   *
472   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
473   * {@code null}.
474   *
475   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
476   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
477   *
478   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
479   * and deterministic.
480   */
481  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeArguments();
482
483  /**
484   * Returns {@code false} when invoked since {@link Type}s don't have
485   * parameters (unlike {@link Owner}s representing {@link
486   * java.lang.reflect.Executable executables}).
487   *
488   * @return {@code false} when invoked
489   *
490   * @nullability This method always returns {@code null}.
491   *
492   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
493   *
494   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
495   * threads.
496   */
497  @Override // Owner<T>
498  public final boolean hasParameters() {
499    return false;
500  }
501
502  /**
503   * Returns {@code null} when invoked since {@link Type}s don't have
504   * parameters (unlike {@link Owner}s representing {@link
505   * java.lang.reflect.Executable executables}).
506   *
507   * @return {@code null} when invoked
508   *
509   * @nullability This method always returns {@code null}.
510   *
511   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
512   *
513   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
514   * threads.
515   */
516  @Override // Owner<T>
517  public final List<? extends Type<T>> parameters() {
518    return null;
519  }
520
521  /**
522   * Returns the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
523   * there is one, <strong>or {@code null} if there is not</strong>.
524   *
525   * <p>Overrides of this method must return a non-{@code null}
526   * result only when this {@link Type} represents a type that is
527   * either an array or a generic array type.</p>
528   *
529   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
530   * meet these requirements.</p>
531   *
532   * @return the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
533   * there is one, or {@code null} if there is not
534   *
535   * @nullability Overrides of this method may return {@code
536   * null}.
537   *
538   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
539   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
540   *
541   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
542   * and deterministic.
543   */
544  public abstract Type<T> componentType();
545
546  /**
547   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
548   * either a type variable or a wildcard type.
549   *
550   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #upperBounds()} method
551   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
552   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
553   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
554   *
555   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
556   * meet these requirements.</p>
557   *
558   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
559   * either a type variable or a wildcard type
560   *
561   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
562   * idempotent and deterministic.
563   *
564   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
565   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
566   *
567   * @see #upperBounds()
568   */
569  @OverridingEncouraged
570  public boolean upperBounded() {
571    return !this.upperBounds().isEmpty();
572  }
573
574  /**
575   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
576   * a wildcard type with a lower bound.
577   *
578   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #lowerBounds()} method
579   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
580   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
581   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
582   *
583   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
584   * meet these requirements.</p>
585   *
586   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
587   * a wildcard type with lower bounds
588   *
589   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
590   * idempotent and deterministic.
591   *
592   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
593   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
594   *
595   * @see #lowerBounds()
596   */
597  @OverridingEncouraged
598  public boolean lowerBounded() {
599    return !this.lowerBounds().isEmpty();
600  }
601
602  /**
603   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
604   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
605   * bounds.
606   *
607   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
608   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
609   * lower-bounded wildcard type.</p>
610   *
611   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
612   * meet these requirements.</p>
613   *
614   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
615   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
616   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
617   * empty}
618   *
619   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
620   * {@code null}.
621   *
622   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
623   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
624   *
625   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
626   * and deterministic.
627   */
628  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> lowerBounds();
629
630  /**
631   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
632   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
633   * bounds.
634   *
635   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
636   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models either a type
637   * variable, an unbounded wildcard type, or an upper-bounded
638   * wildcard type.
639   *
640   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
641   * meet these requirements.</p>
642   *
643   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
644   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
645   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
646   * empty}
647   *
648   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
649   * {@code null}.
650   *
651   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
652   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
653   *
654   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
655   * and deterministic.
656   */
657  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> upperBounds();
658
659  /**
660   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
661   * custom {@linkplain #supertypes() list of supertypes} and nothing
662   * else.
663   *
664   * <p>This method returns {@code true} when and only when all of the
665   * following conditions are met:</p>
666   *
667   * <ul>
668   *
669   * <li>The {@link #object()} method returns {@code null}</li>
670   *
671   * <li>The {@link #hasTypeArguments()} method returns {@code
672   * false}</li>
673   *
674   * <li>The {@link #arrayType()} method returns {@code false}</li>
675   *
676   * <li>The {@link #lowerBounded()} method returns {@code false}</li>
677   *
678   * <li>The {@link #upperBounded()} method returns {@code false}</li>
679   *
680   * <li>The {@link #named()} method returns {@code false}</li>
681   *
682   * </ul>
683   *
684   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link type} models a
685   * custom {@linkplain #supertypes() list of supertypes} and nothing
686   * else
687   *
688   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
689   *
690   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
691   * threads.
692   *
693   * @see #supertypes()
694   *
695   * @see #Type(List)
696   */
697  public final boolean customSupertyped() {
698    return
699      this.object() == null &&
700      !this.named() &&
701      !this.hasTypeArguments() &&
702      !this.arrayType() &&
703      !this.lowerBounded() &&
704      !this.upperBounded();
705  }
706
707  /**
708   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
709   * class or interface.
710   *
711   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
712   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
713   * returns {@code false}.</p>
714   *
715   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
716   * class
717   *
718   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
719   *
720   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
721   * threads.
722   *
723   * @see #named()
724   *
725   * @see #upperBounded()
726   */
727  public final boolean classOrInterface() {
728    return this.named() && !this.upperBounded();
729  }
730
731  /**
732   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models an
733   * array type (which may be a {@linkplain #genericArrayType()
734   * generic array type}).
735   *
736   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
737   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code null} value.</p>
738   *
739   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models an
740   * array type (which may be a {@linkplain #genericArrayType()
741   * generic array type})
742   *
743   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
744   *
745   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
746   * threads.
747   *
748   * @see #componentType()
749   */
750  public final boolean arrayType() {
751    return this.componentType() != null;
752  }
753
754  /**
755   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
756   * generic array type.
757   *
758   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
759   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code null} value and {@link
760   * #type()} returns a {@link Type} that is not {@code this}.</p>
761   *
762   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
763   * generic array type
764   *
765   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
766   *
767   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
768   * threads.
769   *
770   * @see #componentType()
771   *
772   * @see #type()
773   */
774  public final boolean genericArrayType() {
775    return this.componentType() != null && this.type() != this;
776  }
777
778  /**
779   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
780   * non-generic array type.
781   *
782   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
783   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code null} value and {@link
784   * #type()} returns a {@link Type} that is {@code this}.</p>
785   *
786   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
787   * non-generic array type
788   *
789   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
790   *
791   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
792   * threads.
793   *
794   * @see #componentType()
795   *
796   * @see #type()
797   */
798  public final boolean nonGenericArrayType() {
799    return this.componentType() != null && this.type() == this;
800  }
801
802  /**
803   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
804   * parameterized type.
805   *
806   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
807   * #hasTypeArguments()} returns {@code true}.</p>
808   *
809   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
810   * parameterized type
811   *
812   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
813   *
814   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
815   * threads.
816   *
817   * @see #hasTypeArguments()
818   */
819  public final boolean parameterizedType() {
820    return this.hasTypeArguments();
821  }
822
823  /**
824   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
825   * type variable.
826   *
827   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
828   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
829   * returns {@code true}.</p>
830   *
831   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
832   * type variable
833   *
834   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
835   *
836   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
837   * threads.
838   *
839   * @see #named()
840   *
841   * @see #upperBounded()
842   */
843  public final boolean typeVariable() {
844    return this.named() && this.upperBounded();
845  }
846
847  /**
848   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
849   * wildcard type.
850   *
851   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
852   * #named()} returns {@code true} and one of {@link #upperBounded()}
853   * or {@link #lowerBounded()} returns {@code true}.</p>
854   *
855   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
856   * wildcard type
857   *
858   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
859   *
860   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
861   * threads.
862   *
863   * @see #named()
864   *
865   * @see #upperBounded()
866   *
867   * @see #lowerBounded()
868   */
869  public final boolean wildcard() {
870    return !this.named() && (this.upperBounded() || this.lowerBounded());
871  }
872
873  /**
874   * Returns all the supertypes of this {@link Type} (which normally
875   * includes this {@link Type}).
876   *
877   * <p>This method returns a cached list of supertypes, or, if
878   * such a list does not yet exist, returns the result of
879   * invoking the {@link #computeSupertypes()} method.</p>
880   *
881   * @return an {@linkplain
882   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable
883   * <code>List</code>} containing all the supertypes of this
884   * {@link Type} (which normally includes this {@link Type}); never
885   * {@code null}; never {@linkplain Collection#isEmpty() empty}
886   *
887   * @nullability This method does not return {@code null}.
888   *
889   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
890   *
891   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
892   * threads.
893   *
894   * @see #computeSupertypes()
895   */
896  public final List<? extends Type<T>> supertypes() {
897    List<? extends Type<T>> c = this.supertypes; // volatile read
898    if (c == null) {
899      c = List.copyOf(this.computeSupertypes());
900      if (!SUPERTYPES.compareAndSet(this, null, c)) { // volatile write
901        return this.supertypes; // volatile read
902      }
903    }
904    return c;
905  }
906
907  /**
908   * Returns all the supertypes of this {@link Type} (which normally
909   * includes this {@link Type}).
910   *
911   * <p>The returned {@link List} must not be {@code null} and
912   * must not be {@linkplain Collection#isEmpty() empty}.  Undefined
913   * behavior will result if overrides do not adhere to this
914   * requirement.</p>
915   *
916   * <p>The order of elements within the {@link List} returned
917   * by any invocation of this method must be deterministic.
918   * Undefined behavior will result if overrides do not adhere to this
919   * requirement.</p>
920   *
921   * <p>The default implementation of this method reflexively and
922   * transitively applies the direct supertype relation (represented
923   * by the {@link #directSupertypes()} method) to this {@link Type}
924   * and returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
925   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} containing the result.</p>
926   *
927   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
928   * unmodifiable <code>Collection</code>} containing all the
929   * supertypes of this {@link Type} (which includes this {@link
930   * Type}); never {@code null}; never {@linkplain
931   * Collection#isEmpty() empty}
932   *
933   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
934   * return {@code null}.
935   *
936   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
937   * idempotent and deterministic.
938   *
939   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
940   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
941   *
942   * @see #supertypes()
943   *
944   * @see #directSupertypes()
945   *
946   * @see #computeDirectSupertypes()
947   */
948  protected List<? extends Type<T>> computeSupertypes() {
949    return computeSupertypesBreadthFirst(this);
950  }
951
952  /**
953   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
954   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}.
955   *
956   * <p>This method uses a combination of the {@link #supertypes()}
957   * method and the {@link #equals(Type, Type)} method in its
958   * implementation.</p>
959   *
960   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
961   *
962   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
963   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}
964   *
965   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code sub} is {@code null}
966   *
967   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
968   *
969   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
970   * threads.
971   *
972   * @see #supertypes()
973   *
974   * @see #equals(Type, Type)
975   */
976  @Convenience
977  public final boolean supertypeOf(final Type<?> sub) {
978    // Does this represent a supertype of sub?  Remember that the
979    // supertype relation is reflexive.
980    for (final Type<?> supertype : sub.supertypes()) {
981      if (equals(supertype, this)) {
982        return true;
983      }
984    }
985    return false;
986  }
987
988  /**
989   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
990   * subtype of the supplied {@link Type}.
991   *
992   * <p>This method uses a combination of the {@link #supertypes()}
993   * method and the {@link #equals(Type, Type)} method in its
994   * implementation.</p>
995   *
996   * @param sup the purported supertype; must not be {@code null}
997   *
998   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
999   * subtype of the supplied {@link Type}
1000   *
1001   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code sup} is {@code null}
1002   *
1003   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1004   *
1005   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1006   * threads.
1007   *
1008   * @see #supertypes()
1009   *
1010   * @see #equals(Type, Type)
1011   */
1012  @Convenience
1013  public final boolean subtypeOf(final Type<?> sup) {
1014    for (final Type<?> supertype : this.supertypes()) {
1015      if (equals(sup, supertype)) {
1016        return true;
1017      }
1018    }
1019    return false;
1020  }
1021
1022  /**
1023   * Returns a {@link Type}, selected from this {@link Type}'s
1024   * {@linkplain #supertypes() supertypes}, that is the most
1025   * specialized of those {@linkplain #supertypes() supertypes} and
1026   * that passes the test represented by the supplied {@link
1027   * Predicate}.
1028   *
1029   * <p>Often this method will return this {@link Type} itself, since
1030   * normally the set of supertypes of a type include the type
1031   * itself.</p>
1032   *
1033   * @param p the {@link Predicate} imposing additional restructions;
1034   * must not be {@code null}
1035   *
1036   * @return the most specialized {@link Type} meeting the conditions
1037   * above; often this {@link Type} itself
1038   *
1039   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1040   *
1041   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic provided
1042   * that the supplied {@link Predicate} is deterministic.
1043   *
1044   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1045   * threads.
1046   *
1047   * @see #supertypes()
1048   *
1049   * @see #customSupertyped()
1050   */
1051  public final Type<T> mostSpecialized(final Predicate<? super Type<T>> p) {
1052    Type<T> candidate = null;
1053    for (final Type<T> supertype : this.supertypes()) {
1054      if (supertype != candidate && p.test(supertype) && candidate == null || candidate.supertypeOf(supertype)) {
1055        candidate = supertype;
1056      }
1057    }
1058    return candidate;
1059  }
1060  
1061  /**
1062   * Converts this {@link Type} to a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1063   * java.lang.reflect.Type}, loading it if necessary, possibly by
1064   * using the supplied {@link ClassLoader}, and returns it.
1065   *
1066   * @param classLoader a {@link ClassLoader} to use to load any
1067   * unloaded type; may be {@code null}
1068   *
1069   * @return the loaded {@link java.lang.reflect.Type}, or {@code
1070   * null} if the type could not be loaded
1071   *
1072   * @exception ClassNotFoundException if the load operation fails
1073   *
1074   * @nullability Overrides of this method may return {@code null}.
1075   *
1076   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be deterministic.
1077   *
1078   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
1079   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1080   */
1081  @Experimental
1082  public abstract java.lang.reflect.Type load(final ClassLoader classLoader) throws ClassNotFoundException;
1083  
1084  @Override // Object
1085  public int hashCode() {
1086    return hashCode(this);
1087  }
1088
1089  @Override // Owner
1090  public boolean equals(final Object other) {
1091    if (other == this) {
1092      return true;
1093    } else if (other instanceof Type<?> type) { // instanceof is deliberate
1094      return equals(this, type);
1095    } else {
1096      return false;
1097    }
1098  }
1099
1100
1101  /*
1102   * Static methods.
1103   */
1104
1105
1106  /**
1107   * Returns a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type}, independent of
1108   * its particular implementation of the {@link Object#hashCode()}
1109   * method.
1110   *
1111   * @param type the {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
1112   *
1113   * @return a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type}
1114   *
1115   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1116   *
1117   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1118   * threads.
1119   *
1120   * @see #equals(Type, Type)
1121   */
1122  public static final int hashCode(final Type<?> type) {
1123    if (type == null) {
1124      return 0;
1125    }
1126
1127    int hashCode = 1;
1128
1129    final List<? extends Type<?>> typeArguments = type.typeArguments();
1130    if (typeArguments == null || typeArguments.isEmpty()) {
1131      hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1132    } else {
1133      for (final Type<?> arg : typeArguments) {
1134        hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(arg);
1135      }
1136    }
1137
1138    final Type<?> componentType = type.componentType();
1139    hashCode = 31 * hashCode + (componentType == null ? 0 : hashCode(componentType));
1140
1141    final List<? extends Type<?>> lowerBounds = type.lowerBounds();
1142    if (lowerBounds == null || lowerBounds.isEmpty()) {
1143      hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1144    } else {
1145      for (final Type<?> b : lowerBounds) {
1146        hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(b);
1147      }
1148    }
1149
1150    final List<? extends Type<?>> upperBounds = type.upperBounds();
1151    if (upperBounds == null || upperBounds.isEmpty()) {
1152      hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1153    } else {
1154      for (final Type<?> b : upperBounds) {
1155        hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(b);
1156      }
1157    }
1158
1159    final String name = type.name();
1160    if (name == null) {
1161      if (typeArguments == null && componentType == null && lowerBounds == null && upperBounds == null) {
1162        // Just a supertype container
1163        final List<? extends Type<?>> supertypes = type.supertypes();
1164        if (supertypes == null) {
1165          hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1166        } else {
1167          for (final Type<?> supertype : supertypes) {
1168            hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(supertype);
1169          }
1170        }
1171      } else {
1172        hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1173      }
1174    } else {
1175      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + name.hashCode();
1176    }
1177
1178    final Type<?> typeType = type.type();
1179    if (typeType != type) {
1180      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + (typeType == null ? 0 : hashCode(typeType));
1181    }
1182
1183    final Owner<?> owner = type.owner();
1184    if (owner == null) {
1185      hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1186    } else if (owner instanceof Type<?> ownerType) {
1187      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(ownerType);
1188    } else {
1189      for (final Type<?> p : owner.parameters()) {
1190        hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(p);
1191      }
1192      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(owner.type()); // return type
1193      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode((Type<?>)owner.owner()); // declaring class
1194    }
1195
1196    return hashCode;
1197  }
1198
1199  /**
1200   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the two supplied {@link
1201   * Type}s are equal, based solely upon the properties publicly
1202   * exposed by the {@link Type} class.
1203   *
1204   * @param t1 the first {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
1205   *
1206   * @param t2 the second {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
1207   *
1208   * @return {@code true} if and only if the two supplied {@link
1209   * Type}s are equal, based solely upon the properties publicly
1210   * exposed by the {@link Type} abstract class
1211   *
1212   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1213   *
1214   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1215   * threads.
1216   *
1217   * @see #hashCode(Type)
1218   */
1219  public static final boolean equals(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1220    if (t1 == t2) {
1221      return true;
1222    } else if (t1 == null || t2 == null) {
1223      return false;
1224    }
1225
1226    final Object t1Object = t1.object();
1227    if (t1Object == null) {
1228      if (t2.object() != null) {
1229        return false;
1230      }
1231    } else {
1232      return t1.objectEquals(t2.object());
1233    }
1234
1235    if (t1.hasTypeArguments()) {
1236      if (!t2.hasTypeArguments()) {
1237        return false;
1238      }
1239      return parameterizedTypeEqualsParameterizedType(t1, t2);
1240    } else if (t2.hasTypeArguments()) {
1241      return false;
1242    }
1243
1244    final Type<?> t1ComponentType = t1.componentType();
1245    final Type<?> t2ComponentType = t2.componentType();
1246    if (t1ComponentType == null) {
1247      if (t2ComponentType != null) {
1248        return false;
1249      } else if (t1.lowerBounded()) {
1250        return lowerBoundedWildcardTypeEqualsType(t1, t2);
1251      } else if (t1.upperBounded()) {
1252        return upperBoundedTypeEqualsType(t1, t2);
1253      } else if (t2.lowerBounded() || t2.upperBounded()) {
1254        return false;
1255      }
1256
1257      // Not parameterized type.
1258      // Not array type.
1259      // Not generic array type.
1260      // Not type variable.
1261      // Not wildcard.
1262      final String t1Name = t1.name();
1263      final String t2Name = t2.name();
1264      if (t1Name == null) {
1265        // The only way this can happen is if t1 is actually just a
1266        // placeholder for its supertypes.
1267        if (t2Name != null) {
1268          return false;
1269        }
1270        return supertypesEqual(t1, t2);
1271      } else {
1272        return
1273          t1Name.equals(t2Name) &&
1274          equals((Type<?>)t1.owner(), (Type<?>)t2.owner());
1275      }
1276    } else if (!equals(t1ComponentType, t2ComponentType)) {
1277      return false;
1278    }
1279
1280    // Non-null component types are equal; these are arrays
1281    final Type<?> t1Type = t1.type();
1282    final Type<?> t2Type = t2.type();
1283    if (t1Type == t1) {
1284      return t2Type == t2;
1285    } else if (t2Type == t2) {
1286      return false;
1287    }
1288    // Generic array types.
1289    return equals(t1Type, t2Type);
1290  }
1291
1292  private static final boolean supertypesEqual(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1293    if (t1 == t2) {
1294      return true;
1295    } else if (t1 == null || t2 == null) {
1296      return false;
1297    }
1298    final List<? extends Type<?>> s1 = t1.supertypes();
1299    final List<? extends Type<?>> s2 = t2.supertypes();
1300    final int size = s1.size();
1301    if (s2.size() != size) {
1302      return false;
1303    }
1304    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1305      final Type<?> supertype1 = s1.get(i);
1306      if (supertype1 != s1 && supertype1 != s2) {
1307        final Type<?> supertype2 = s2.get(i);
1308        if (supertype2 != t1 && supertype2 != t2 && !equals(supertype1, supertype2)) {
1309          return false;
1310        }
1311      }
1312    }
1313    return true;
1314  }
1315
1316  private static final boolean parameterizedTypeEqualsParameterizedType(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1317    assert t1 != t2;
1318    assert t1.hasTypeArguments();
1319    assert t2.hasTypeArguments();
1320
1321    final List<? extends Type<?>> t1Args = t1.typeArguments();
1322    final List<? extends Type<?>> t2Args = t2.typeArguments();
1323    int size = t1Args.size();
1324    if (t2Args.size() != size) {
1325      return false;
1326    }
1327    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1328      if (!equals(t1Args.get(i), t2Args.get(i))) {
1329        return false;
1330      }
1331    }
1332    assert t1.type() != t1;
1333    assert t2.type() != t2;
1334    return equals(t1.type(), t2.type());
1335  }
1336
1337  private static final boolean lowerBoundedWildcardTypeEqualsType(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1338    assert t1 != t2;
1339    assert t1.lowerBounded();
1340
1341    final List<? extends Type<?>> t1LowerBounds = t1.lowerBounds();
1342    final List<? extends Type<?>> t2LowerBounds = t2.lowerBounds();
1343    final int size = t1LowerBounds.size();
1344    if (t2LowerBounds.size() != size) {
1345      return false;
1346    }
1347    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1348      if (!equals(t1LowerBounds.get(i), t2LowerBounds.get(i))) {
1349        return false;
1350      }
1351    }
1352    return true;
1353  }
1354
1355  private static final boolean upperBoundedTypeEqualsType(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1356    assert t1 != t2;
1357    assert t1.upperBounded();
1358
1359    if (!t2.upperBounded()) {
1360      return false;
1361    }
1362
1363    final String t1Name = t1.name();
1364    if (!Objects.equals(t1Name, t2.name())) {
1365      return false;
1366    }
1367
1368    final List<? extends Type<?>> t1UpperBounds = t1.upperBounds();
1369    final List<? extends Type<?>> t2UpperBounds = t2.upperBounds();
1370    final int size = t1UpperBounds.size();
1371    if (t2UpperBounds.size() != size) {
1372      return false;
1373    }
1374    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1375      if (!equals(t1UpperBounds.get(i), t2UpperBounds.get(i))) {
1376        return false;
1377      }
1378    }
1379
1380    if (t1Name != null) {
1381      // Two identically-named but not identical type variables.
1382      final Owner<?> t1Owner = t1.owner();
1383      final Owner<?> t2Owner = t2.owner();
1384      if (t1Owner == null || t2Owner == null) {
1385        // Type variables have to be declared by *some* owner, whether
1386        // it be a class or an executable.
1387        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
1388      } else if (t1Owner instanceof Type<?> t1OwnerType) {
1389        return t2Owner instanceof Type<?> t2OwnerType && equals(t1OwnerType, t2OwnerType);
1390      } else {
1391        return executableEqualsExecutable(t1Owner, t2Owner);
1392      }
1393    }
1394
1395    // Two upper bounded (nameless) wildcards with the same bounds;
1396    // they're equal.
1397    return true;
1398  }
1399
1400  private static final boolean executableEqualsExecutable(final Owner<?> o1, final Owner<?> o2) {
1401    assert o1 != o2;
1402    assert o1.hasTypeParameters();
1403    assert o2.hasTypeParameters();
1404    assert o1.named();
1405    assert o2.named();
1406    assert o1.hasParameters();
1407    assert o2.hasParameters();
1408    assert !(o1 instanceof Type);
1409    assert !(o2 instanceof Type);
1410
1411    if (!Objects.equals(o1.name(), o2.name())) {
1412      return false;
1413    }
1414    final List<? extends Type<?>> o1Parameters = o1.parameters();
1415    final List<? extends Type<?>> o2Parameters = o2.parameters();
1416    final int size = o1Parameters.size();
1417    if (o2Parameters.size() != size) {
1418      return false;
1419    }
1420    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1421      if (!equals(o1Parameters.get(i), o2Parameters.get(i))) {
1422        return false;
1423      }
1424    }
1425    return
1426      !equals(o1.type(), o2.type()) ||
1427      !equals((Type<?>)o1.owner(), (Type<?>)o2.owner());
1428  }
1429
1430  /**
1431   * A utility method that maps the supplied {@link Collection} into
1432   * an unmodifiable {@link List} using the supplied mapping
1433   * function.
1434   *
1435   * @param <T> the type of the incoming elements
1436   *
1437   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Collection}'s elements
1438   *
1439   * @param c the incoming {@link Collection}; may be {@code null}
1440   *
1441   * @param f the mapping {@link Function}
1442   *
1443   * @return an unmodifiable mapped {@link List}
1444   *
1445   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1446   *
1447   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1448   *
1449   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1450   * threads.  It does not synchronize on the supplied {@link
1451   * Collection} when iterating over it.
1452   */
1453  static final <T, U> List<U> map(final Collection<? extends T> c, final Function<? super T, ? extends U> f) {
1454    if (c == null || c.isEmpty()) {
1455      return List.of();
1456    }
1457    final Iterator<? extends T> i = c.iterator();
1458    switch (c.size()) {
1459    case 0:
1460      throw new AssertionError();
1461    case 1:
1462      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()));
1463    case 2:
1464      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1465                     f.apply(i.next()));
1466    case 3:
1467      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1468                     f.apply(i.next()),
1469                     f.apply(i.next()));
1470    case 4:
1471      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1472                     f.apply(i.next()),
1473                     f.apply(i.next()),
1474                     f.apply(i.next()));
1475    case 5:
1476      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1477                     f.apply(i.next()),
1478                     f.apply(i.next()),
1479                     f.apply(i.next()),
1480                     f.apply(i.next()));
1481    case 6:
1482      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1483                     f.apply(i.next()),
1484                     f.apply(i.next()),
1485                     f.apply(i.next()),
1486                     f.apply(i.next()),
1487                     f.apply(i.next()));
1488    case 7:
1489      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1490                     f.apply(i.next()),
1491                     f.apply(i.next()),
1492                     f.apply(i.next()),
1493                     f.apply(i.next()),
1494                     f.apply(i.next()),
1495                     f.apply(i.next()));
1496    case 8:
1497      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1498                     f.apply(i.next()),
1499                     f.apply(i.next()),
1500                     f.apply(i.next()),
1501                     f.apply(i.next()),
1502                     f.apply(i.next()),
1503                     f.apply(i.next()),
1504                     f.apply(i.next()));
1505    case 9:
1506      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1507                     f.apply(i.next()),
1508                     f.apply(i.next()),
1509                     f.apply(i.next()),
1510                     f.apply(i.next()),
1511                     f.apply(i.next()),
1512                     f.apply(i.next()),
1513                     f.apply(i.next()),
1514                     f.apply(i.next()));
1515    case 10:
1516      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1517                     f.apply(i.next()),
1518                     f.apply(i.next()),
1519                     f.apply(i.next()),
1520                     f.apply(i.next()),
1521                     f.apply(i.next()),
1522                     f.apply(i.next()),
1523                     f.apply(i.next()),
1524                     f.apply(i.next()),
1525                     f.apply(i.next()));
1526    default:
1527      final List<U> rv = new ArrayList<>(c.size());
1528      while (i.hasNext()) {
1529        rv.add(f.apply(i.next()));
1530      }
1531      return Collections.unmodifiableList(rv);
1532    }
1533  }
1534
1535  /**
1536   * A utility method that maps the supplied array into an
1537   * unmodifiable {@link List} using the supplied mapping function.
1538   *
1539   * @param <T> the type of the incoming elements
1540   *
1541   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link List}'s elements
1542   *
1543   * @param c the incoming array; may be {@code null}
1544   *
1545   * @param f the mapping {@link Function}
1546   *
1547   * @return an unmodifiable mapped {@link List}
1548   *
1549   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1550   *
1551   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1552   *
1553   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1554   * threads.  It does not synchronize on the supplied array when
1555   * accessing its elements.
1556   */
1557  static final <T, U> List<U> map(final T[] c, final Function<? super T, ? extends U> f) {
1558    if (c == null) {
1559      return List.of();
1560    }
1561    switch (c.length) {
1562    case 0:
1563      return List.of();
1564    case 1:
1565      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]));
1566    case 2:
1567      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1568                     f.apply(c[1]));
1569    case 3:
1570      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1571                     f.apply(c[1]),
1572                     f.apply(c[2]));
1573    case 4:
1574      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1575                     f.apply(c[1]),
1576                     f.apply(c[2]),
1577                     f.apply(c[3]));
1578    case 5:
1579      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1580                     f.apply(c[1]),
1581                     f.apply(c[2]),
1582                     f.apply(c[3]),
1583                     f.apply(c[4]));
1584    case 6:
1585      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1586                     f.apply(c[1]),
1587                     f.apply(c[2]),
1588                     f.apply(c[3]),
1589                     f.apply(c[4]),
1590                     f.apply(c[5]));
1591    case 7:
1592      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1593                     f.apply(c[1]),
1594                     f.apply(c[2]),
1595                     f.apply(c[3]),
1596                     f.apply(c[4]),
1597                     f.apply(c[5]),
1598                     f.apply(c[6]));
1599    case 8:
1600      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1601                     f.apply(c[1]),
1602                     f.apply(c[2]),
1603                     f.apply(c[3]),
1604                     f.apply(c[4]),
1605                     f.apply(c[5]),
1606                     f.apply(c[6]),
1607                     f.apply(c[7]));
1608    case 9:
1609      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1610                     f.apply(c[1]),
1611                     f.apply(c[2]),
1612                     f.apply(c[3]),
1613                     f.apply(c[4]),
1614                     f.apply(c[5]),
1615                     f.apply(c[6]),
1616                     f.apply(c[7]),
1617                     f.apply(c[8]));
1618    case 10:
1619      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1620                     f.apply(c[1]),
1621                     f.apply(c[2]),
1622                     f.apply(c[3]),
1623                     f.apply(c[4]),
1624                     f.apply(c[5]),
1625                     f.apply(c[6]),
1626                     f.apply(c[7]),
1627                     f.apply(c[8]),
1628                     f.apply(c[9]));
1629    default:
1630      final List<U> rv = new ArrayList<>(c.length);
1631      for (int i = 0; i < c.length; i++) {
1632        rv.add(f.apply(c[i]));
1633      }
1634      return Collections.unmodifiableList(rv);
1635    }
1636  }
1637
1638  private static final <X> List<? extends Type<X>> computeSupertypesBreadthFirst(final Type<X> type) {
1639    final ArrayList<Type<X>> supertypes = new ArrayList<>(16);
1640    final Queue<Type<X>> q = new ArrayDeque<>(8);
1641    q.add(type);
1642    while (!q.isEmpty()) {
1643      final Type<X> head = q.remove();
1644      supertypes.add(head);
1645      q.addAll(head.directSupertypes());
1646    }
1647    supertypes.trimToSize();
1648    return Collections.unmodifiableList(supertypes);
1649  }
1650
1651
1652  /*
1653   * Inner and nested classes.
1654   */
1655
1656
1657  /**
1658   * An abstract embodiment of {@link Type} {@linkplain
1659   * #assignable(Type, Type) assignability rules}.
1660   *
1661   * <p>By default, no {@link Type} {@linkplain #assignable(Type,
1662   * Type) is assignable} to any other {@link Type} except itself.
1663   * Subclasses will obviously want to override this behavior in some,
1664   * if not all, cases.</p>
1665   *
1666   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
1667   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
1668   *
1669   * @see VariantSemantics
1670   *
1671   * @see InvariantSemantics
1672   *
1673   * @see CovariantSemantics
1674   *
1675   * @see CdiSemantics
1676   */
1677  @Experimental
1678  public static abstract class Semantics {
1679
1680
1681    /*
1682     * Constructors.
1683     */
1684
1685
1686    /**
1687     * Creates a new {@link Semantics}.
1688     */
1689    protected Semantics() {
1690      super();
1691    }
1692
1693
1694    /*
1695     * Instance methods.
1696     */
1697
1698
1699    /**
1700     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1701     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1702     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1703     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1704     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing.
1705     *
1706     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
1707     * JavaType#of(boolean, java.lang.reflect.Type) creates
1708     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
1709     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
1710     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
1711     *
1712     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1713     * not be {@code null}
1714     *
1715     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
1716     * not be {@code null}
1717     *
1718     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1719     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1720     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1721     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1722     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing;
1723     * {@code false} otherwise
1724     *
1725     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1726     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
1727     *
1728     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1729     * idempotent and deterministic.
1730     *
1731     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1732     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1733     *
1734     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1735     *
1736     * @see JavaType#of(boolean, java.lang.reflect.Type)
1737     */
1738    @Convenience
1739    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1740                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType) {
1741      return this.assignable(receiverType, payloadType, false);
1742    }
1743
1744    /**
1745     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1746     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1747     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1748     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1749     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
1750     * autoboxing semantics.
1751     *
1752     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
1753     * JavaType#of(boolean, java.lang.reflect.Type) creates
1754     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
1755     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
1756     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
1757     *
1758     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1759     * not be {@code null}
1760     *
1761     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
1762     * not be {@code null}
1763     *
1764     * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
1765     *
1766     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1767     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1768     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1769     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1770     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
1771     * autoboxing semantics; {@code false} otherwise
1772     *
1773     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1774     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
1775     *
1776     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1777     * idempotent and deterministic.
1778     *
1779     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1780     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1781     *
1782     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1783     *
1784     * @see JavaType#of(boolean, java.lang.reflect.Type)
1785     */
1786    @Convenience
1787    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1788                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType,
1789                              final boolean box) {
1790      return this.assignable(JavaType.of(box, receiverType), JavaType.of(box, payloadType));
1791    }
1792
1793    /**
1794     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1795     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1796     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1797     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1798     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1799     *
1800     * <p>No autoboxing of types takes place.</p>
1801     *
1802     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1803     * not be {@code null}
1804     *
1805     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1806     * not be {@code null}
1807     *
1808     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1809     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1810     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1811     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1812     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1813     * {@code false} otherwise
1814     *
1815     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1816     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1817     *
1818     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1819     * idempotent and deterministic.
1820     *
1821     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1822     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1823     *
1824     * @see #anyAssignable(java.lang.reflect.Type, Collection,
1825     * boolean)
1826     */
1827    @Convenience
1828    public final boolean anyAssignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1829                                       final Collection<? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> payloadTypes) {
1830      return this.anyAssignable(receiverType, payloadTypes, false);
1831    }
1832
1833    /**
1834     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1835     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1836     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1837     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1838     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1839     *
1840     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1841     * not be {@code null}
1842     *
1843     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1844     * not be {@code null}
1845     *
1846     * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
1847     *
1848     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1849     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1850     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1851     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1852     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1853     * {@code false} otherwise
1854     *
1855     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1856     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1857     *
1858     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1859     * idempotent and deterministic.
1860     *
1861     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1862     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1863     */
1864    @Convenience
1865    public final boolean anyAssignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1866                                       final Collection<? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> payloadTypes,
1867                                       final boolean box) {
1868      final JavaType receiverJavaType = JavaType.of(box, receiverType);
1869      for (final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType : payloadTypes) {
1870        if (this.assignable(receiverJavaType, JavaType.of(box, payloadType))) {
1871          return true;
1872        }
1873      }
1874      return false;
1875    }
1876
1877    /**
1878     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1879     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1880     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1881     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1882     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1883     *
1884     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1885     * receiverType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1886     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1887     *
1888     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by a {@code payloadTypes}
1889     * element; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1890     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1891     *
1892     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1893     * not be {@code null}
1894     *
1895     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1896     * not be {@code null}
1897     *
1898     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1899     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1900     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1901     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1902     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1903     * {@code false} otherwise
1904     *
1905     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1906     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1907     *
1908     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1909     * idempotent and deterministic.
1910     *
1911     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1912     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1913     */
1914    @Convenience
1915    public final <X, Y> boolean anyAssignable(final Type<X> receiverType,
1916                                              final Collection<? extends Type<Y>> payloadTypes) {
1917      for (final Type<Y> payloadType : payloadTypes) {
1918        if (this.assignable(receiverType, payloadType)) {
1919          return true;
1920        }
1921      }
1922      return false;
1923    }
1924
1925    /**
1926     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1927     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1928     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1929     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1930     * this {@link Semantics} instance.
1931     *
1932     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1933     * receiverType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1934     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1935     *
1936     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadType};
1937     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1938     *
1939     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1940     * not be {@code null}
1941     *
1942     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
1943     * not be {@code null}
1944     *
1945     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1946     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1947     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1948     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1949     * this {@link Semantics} instance; {@code false} otherwise
1950     *
1951     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1952     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
1953     *
1954     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1955     * idempotent and deterministic.
1956     *
1957     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1958     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1959     */
1960    @EntryPoint
1961    @OverridingDiscouraged
1962    public <X, Y> boolean assignable(final Type<X> receiverType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
1963      if (receiverType == Objects.requireNonNull(payloadType, "payloadType")) {
1964        return true;
1965      } else if (receiverType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1966        return parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(receiverType, payloadType);
1967      } else if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1968        return this.nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1969      } else if (receiverType.componentType() == null) {
1970        if (receiverType.lowerBounded()) {
1971          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, true, payloadType);
1972        } else if (receiverType.upperBounded()) {
1973          if (receiverType.named()) {
1974            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1975          } else {
1976            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, false, payloadType);
1977          }
1978        } else {
1979          return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1980        }
1981      } else if (receiverType.type() == receiverType) {
1982        return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1983      } else {
1984        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1985      }
1986    }
1987
1988    private final <X, Y> boolean nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverNonParameterizedType,
1989                                                                                       final Type<Y> payloadParameterizedType) {
1990      if (receiverNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1991        if (receiverNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1992          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, true /* lower bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
1993        } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1994          if (receiverNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1995            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1996          } else {
1997            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, false /* upper bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
1998          }
1999        } else {
2000          return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
2001        }
2002      } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.type() == receiverNonParameterizedType) {
2003        return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
2004      } else {
2005        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
2006      }
2007    }
2008
2009    private final <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverClass,
2010                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2011      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
2012        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
2013          return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
2014        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
2015          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
2016            return this.classIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2017          } else {
2018            return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
2019          }
2020        } else {
2021          return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2022        }
2023      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2024        return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2025      } else {
2026        return this.classIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2027      }
2028    }

2255    private final <X, Y> boolean parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(final Type<X> receiverParameterizedType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
2256      if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
2257        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2258      } else if (payloadType.componentType() == null) {
2259        if (payloadType.lowerBounded()) {
2260          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, true);
2261        } else if (payloadType.upperBounded()) {
2262          if (payloadType.named()) {
2263            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2264          } else {
2265            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, false);
2266          }
2267        } else {
2268          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2269        }
2270      } else if (payloadType.type() == payloadType) {
2271        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2272      } else {
2273        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2274      }
2275    }

2532        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2533      } else {
2534        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);

2730     * and if and only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java
2731     * {@linkplain java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and
2732     * not any other type, and if and only if {@code
2733     * receiverGenericArrayType} models a {@linkplain
2734     * java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType generic array type} and not
2735     * any other type.
2736     *
2737     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
2738     * method.</p>
2739     *
2740     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
2741     *
2742     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
2743     * receiverGenericArrayType}; often a {@link
2744     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
2745     *
2746     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadWildcardType};
2747     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
2748     *
2749     * @param receiverGenericArrayType the receiver type as described
2750     * above; must not be {@code null}
2751     *
2752     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
2753     * not be {@code null}
2754     *
2755     * @param lowerBounded whether {@code payloadWildcardType} is a
2756     * lower-bounded wildcard type
2757     *
2758     * @return {@code false} in all cases
2759     *
2760     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
2761     * idempotent and deterministic.
2762     *

2764     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
2765     *

2770                                                                          final Type<Y> payloadWildcardType,
2771                                                                          final boolean lowerBounded) {
2772      return false;
2773    }
2774
2775    private final <X, Y> boolean typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverTypeVariable,
2776                                                                                  final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2777      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
2778        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
2779          return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
2780        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
2781          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
2782            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2783          } else {
2784            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
2785          }
2786        } else {
2787          return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2788        }
2789      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2790        return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2791      } else {
2792        return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2793      }
2794    }
